physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Five female PHP1B patients presented with hypercalcemia and elevated PTH levels.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patients developed hypercalcemia and elevated PTH levels between the ages of 39 and 58, occurring 21â€“42 years after the diagnosis of PHP1B.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Neck ultrasound and sestamibi scan localized an enlarged parathyroid gland inferior to the right thyroid lobe.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 7 years after surgery, serum calcium, PTH, and urine calcium were all normal.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Localized an enlarged parathyroid gland in the left lower neck.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 10 years after surgery, patient remains eucalcemic with normal PTH.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ultrasound showed an enlarged left-sided parathyroid gland.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Fifteen months postoperative, the patient remained eucalcemic with elevated PTH, which was significantly lower than before surgery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Calvarial hyperostosis and periosteal resorption; an enlarged right inferior parathyroid gland that was resected.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: On postoperative day 3, PTH was 119 ng/liter. She was discharged on substantial calcium and calcitriol doses.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Enlarged parathyroid glands localized on ultrasound.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 1.5 months of treatment with cinacalcet, serum calcium level slightly increased, with significant decreases in serum PTH.
